body: This maintenance release fixes a bug that caused severe performance issues with large Schematron files.
This maintenance release fixes a bug in the XProc 3.0 pipeline causing the ```schxslt:validate-with-schematron``` to not work properly.
This maintenance release fixes a bug in the XSLT 2.0/3.0 compiler that caused instantiating abstract patterns to fail under certain circumstances.
This maintanance release fixes a bug in the XSLT 2.0/3.0 compiler that caused the validation stylesheet to fail when called to validate a node not rooted at a document node (#259).

I am pleased to announce the release of SchXslt 1.9, a modern XSLT-based Schematron processor.

You can download this version SchXslt from its [project page](https://github.com/schxslt/schxslt/releases/tag/v1.9). Developers using SchXslt in a Java-based project can add or update the Maven artifact to version 1.9.

# Enhancements

#208 SchXslt now replaces abstract pattern parameters in diagnostics and properties.

# Fixed bugs

#226 Placeholders are not replaced in the sch:value-of @‍select attribute inside a sch:property when instantiating an abstract pattern
#227 Placeholders are not replaced in the sch:value-of @‍select attribute inside a sch:diagnostic when instantiating an abstract pattern
#228 Placeholders are not replaced in the xsl:copy-of @‍select attribute inside a sch:property when instantiating an abstract pattern
#246 The output of the command line applications help option contained a wrong class name
#255 Attributes from the xml:* namespace missing in SVRL output

This maintenance release fixes the following bugs:

- #232 The compiled validation stylesheet lost its static base URI causing the validation to fail in some cases
- #231 The content of a pattern's sch:title elemen is preserved in the SVRL @‍name attribute
- #230 Abstract pattern parameters where not replaced in the @‍documents attribute (XSLT 1.0 compiler only)
- #229 Attribute values where lost when instantiating an abstract pattern with no pattern parameters (XSLT 1.0 compiler only)

This maintenance release fixes three bugs:

- #221 Relative URI references in @‍documents are not resolved against the base URI of the original instance document
- #222 The xsl:copy inside a sch:property is not executed
- #223 Infinite recursion when instantiating an abstract pattern (XSLT 1.0 only)
This maintenance release contains the actual fix for #216.
This maintenance release fixes a bug that caused rules to not fire when a preceding rule matched the document node (#216).
This maintenance release fixes a bug that caused the SVRL validation stylesheet to output the internal report rather instead of the SVRL report (#212).
This maintenance release fixes a bug that caused the validation stylesheet to report activated patterns twice when validating subordinate documents (#210).

I am pleased to announce the release of SchXslt 1.8, a modern XSLT-based Schematron processor.

You can download this version SchXslt from its [project page](https://github.com/schxslt/schxslt/releases/tag/v1.8). Developers using SchXslt in a Java-based project can add or update the Maven artifact to version 1.8.

This version of SchXslt comes with the following enhancements.

## Enhancements

You can turn of the generation of metadata by setting parameter ```schxslt.compile.metadata``` to false() when compiling the validation stylesheet (#206).

## Fixed bugs

The sch:value-of instruction was not handled inside a property (#197).
This maintenance release fixes a bug that validation to fail with an error when using a Schematron with a pattern whose rules processed the same node (see #204).
This maintenance release fixes a severe bug that caused errors when processing top-level variables with element content containing attributes (see #199).
This maintenance release removes the same-pattern-restriction on abstract rules. Abstract rules are now effectively global by default.

This maintenance release fixes a major bug that caused the validation applied multiple times.

See #187

I am pleased to announce the release of SchXslt 1.7, a modern XSLT-based Schematron processor.

You can download this version SchXslt from its [project page](https://github.com/schxslt/schxslt/releases/tag/v1.7). Developers using SchXslt in a Java-based project can add or update the Maven artifact to version 1.7.

This version of SchXslt comes with the following enhancements.

## Enhancements

SchXslt now copies ```xsl:use-package``` instructions to the validation stylesheet when the query binding is XSLT 3.

SchXslt now supports abstract rules defined in a top-level ```sch:rules``` element.

## Fixed bugs

#161 Fixed a bug where the compiler created a validation stylesheet with ```xsl:mode``` instructions for empty patterns.

#162 Fixed a bug where the compiler created a validation stylesheet that declared the default mode multiple times.

#163 Fixed a bug where the micropipeline included the same external document twice.

#164 Fixed a bug where the SVRL generator did not copy the ```@see```, ```@fpi```, and ```@icon``` attributes.

#166 Fixed the handling of base URIs when creating the validation stylesheet. SchXslt does no longer insert spurious ```@xml:base``` attributes in the validation stylesheet.

#170 Fixed a bug where the SVRL generator did not preserve rich text elements like ```span``` and ```emph```.

#173 Fixed a bug where the compiler created spurious phase variables in the validation stylesheet.

#182 Fixed a bug where the ```sch:extends``` element was processed everywhere. It is only allowed as a child of a ```sch:rule``` element.
This mainentance release fixes a bug that caused the SVRL report to contain elements of the internal report.
This maintenance release fixes a bug that caused the @‍location attribute of a svrl:successful-report element to contain the call to the location function instead of the path to the node location.

This version of SchXslt comes with the following enhancements.

(Issue #152, #154, #156) SchXslt allows the following additional elements from the XSLT namespace to be used before the pattern elements:

- xsl:import
- xsl:import-schema
- xsl:include
- xsl:accumulator

(Issue #146) This version of SchXslt adds tentative support for streaming validation templates. If the xs:boolean option 'schxslt.compile.streamable' is set to true, all modes used by the validation stylesheet are marked as streamable.

Please be aware that the default location function cannot be used in a streaming template and must be replaced with a user-defined function that can.

(Issue #149) The target XSLT version is available to API templates as the tunnel parameter 'xslt-version'.

(Issue #147) The default location function uses the built-in fn:path() function if the query language is XSLT 3.0 and no user-defined location function is provided.

(Issue #144) Suppressed (shadowed) rules are no longer reported via a xsl:message.

## Bugs

(Issue #151) Fixed a bug that caused the report to use the URI of the Schematron instead of the validated document.

(Issue #155) The XSLT 1.0 compiler did not copy xsl:key elements to the validation stylesheet.

name: v1.5.2
body:
This maintenance release fixes a bug that caused the validation stylesheet to fail if it uses a namespace prefix other than 'xsl' for the XSLT instructions.

Fixed Bugs
--

Issue #148 Call to system-property('xsl:...') fails if the validation stylesheet does not use the prefix xsl
This maintenance release fixes a broken Maven setup.

I am pleased to announce the release of SchXslt 1.5, a modern XSLT-based Schematron processor.

You can download this version SchXslt from its [project page](https://github.com/schxslt/schxslt). Developers using SchXslt in a Java-based project can add or update the [Maven artifact](https://search.maven.org/artifact/name.dmaus.schxslt/schxslt) to version 1.5.

This version of SchXslt comes with the following enhancements.

Improved tracking of the context node
--

SchXslt groups patterns whose rules can run in a single XSLT mode using the xsl:next-match instruction. Version 1.5 of SchXslt improves
the code that is used to track the context node in a chain of xsl:next-match calls such that it removes a call to generate-id() for
every node matched by a rule.

Typed variables
--

SchXslt implements typed variables as outline in the [Schematron Enhancement Proposal 1](https://github.com/Schematron/schematron-enhancement-proposals/issues/1). A Schematron variable now has an optional @as attribute with the same semantics as described in section 9.3 of the [XSLT 2.0](https://www.w3.org/TR/2009/PER-xslt20-20090421/#variable-values) and [XSLT 3.0](https://www.w3.org/TR/2017/REC-xslt-30-20170608/#variable-values) specification respectively.

Structured Metadata about processors
--

The validation stylesheet and the SVRL report now contain structured metadata about the processor configuration. SchXslt uses striped
RDF/XML to give information about the version of the XSLT processor, the version of SchXslt and any SchXslt compiler options. The RDF/XML adheres to the following grammar:

```
  namespace dc = "http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"
  namespace dct = "http://purl.org/dc/terms/"
  namespace rdf = "http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"
  namespace skos = "http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#"
  namespace schxslt = "https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1495494#"

  start =
      element rdf:Description {
          SchXsltProcessor | XsltProcessor
      }

  SchXsltProcessor =
      element dct:creator {
          element dct:Agent {
              element skos:prefLabel {
                  text
              } &
              element schxslt:schxslt.compile.typed-variables {
                  xsd:boolean
              } &
              empty
          } &
          empty
      } &
      element dct:created {
          xsd:dateTime
      } &
      empty

  XsltProcessor =
      element dct:creator {
          element dct:Agent {
              element skos:prefLabel {
                  text
              } &
              empty
          } &
          empty
      } &
      element dct:created {
          xsd:dataTime
      } &
      element dct:source {
          SchXsltProcessor
      } &
      empty
```

Micro-pipeline
--

The steps include, expand, and compile are integrated in a micro-pipeline such that a single stylesheet can be used to create the
validation stylesheet. The pipeline stylesheets are [pipeline.xsl](core/src/main/resources/xslt/2.0/pipeline.xsl) and
[pipeline-for-svrl.xsl](core/src/main/resources/xslt/2.0/pipeline-for-svrl.xsl) respectively.

Build process
---

This version of SchXslt also marks a complete overhaul of the build process. The Ant step and the commandline validation tool have been
merged to the main repository which is now set up as a Maven multi-module project. The XQuery modules for BaseX and eXist are moved to module subdirectories, too. Packaging SchXslt now creates the following artifacts:

- a Java archive with the XSLT stylesheets and the XProc pipelines
- a Zip-file with just the XSLT stylesheets
- a Xar-file for BaseX
- a Xar-file for eXist
- a Java archive with the Ant step
- a Java archive with the commandline validation tool

Special thanks to [Duncan Paterson](https://github.com/duncdrum) who helped setting up the modular Maven project.

Misc smaller enhancements
--

The XQuery modules now expose the schxslt:compile() function and validation with SchXslt has been implemented as an XProc 3.0 step.

Fixed Bugs
--

- (Issue #132) SchXslt now signals an error if a rule extends an abstract rule defined in a different pattern
- (Issue #139) Fixed a bug in the API specification that could cause SchXslt to create a validation template where the validation logic could be optimized away by an XSLT processor
- (Issue #131) Fixed a bug where the XQuery modules reported an error for a Schematron with query binding of 'xslt3'.

This maintenance release of SchXslt fixes a bug that caused the XSLT 2.0 compiler to fail if an abstract pattern parameter replacement contained literal backslash characters.

## Fixed Bugs

* (#142) Invalid XPath expression in expand.xsl when replacement contains backslash characters

This maintenance release of SchXslt fixes a severe bug that caused the XSLT 2.0 compiler to fail if a pattern declared more than one variable and a bug that caused xsl-instructions inside a variable declaration to be executed.

## Fixed Bugs

* (#129) Compiler fails if a pattern has more than one variable
* (#130) XSLT instructions in the element content of a variable are executed

This maintenance release of SchXslt fixes a bug that caused the XSLT 1.0 and XSLT 2.0 compiler to create invalid validations stylesheets when an assertion test or a rule context expression contained literal curly brackets.

## Fixed Bugs

(#113) Validation stylesheet fails to run if assertion test contains literal curly brackets

This maintenance release of SchXslt fixes a regression that prevented the human-readable content of an assertion to be properly copied to the SVRL report.

## Bugs

(#93) Content of an assertion is not properly copied to the SVRL output

This maintenance release of SchXslt fixes an issue with the XQuery modules. It is now possible to pass parameters to the validation stylesheet. To do this you need to define global variables in the Schematron and call the XQuery function schxslt:validate() with a map(*) as fourth parameter that contains a key "validate" with a map(*) that contains the parameters.

## Example

### Schematron

```xml
<sch:schema xmlns:sch="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron">
  <sch:let name="variable" value="'placeholder'"/>
  <sch:pattern>
    <sch:rule context="sch:schema">
      <sch:report test="$variable = 1"/>
    </sch:rule>
  </sch:pattern>
</sch:schema>
```

### XQuery

```xquery
schxslt:validate($schema, $schema, (), map{"validate": map{"variable": 1}})
```

### Report

```xml
<svrl:schematron-output xmlns:svrl="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/svrl">
  <svrl:active-pattern/>
  <svrl:fired-rule context="sch:schema"/>
  <svrl:successful-report location="/Q{http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron}schema[1]" test="$variable = 1">
    <svrl:text/>
  </svrl:successful-report>
</svrl:schematron-output>
```

I am pleased to announce the release of SchXslt 1.4, a modern XSLT-based Schematron processor.

Starting with this release, the provided SVRL-generating XSLT 2.0 compiler stylesheet creates a validation stylesheet that reports rules that where not checked because their context node was matched by a previous rule in the same pattern. These rules are reported by a ```svrl:suppressed-rule``` element with a content model equal to ```svrl:fired-rule```.

You can download this version SchXslt from its project page.

## Enhancements

* (#90) XSLT 1.0 compiler stylesheets detects name collisions in globally scoped variables
* (#78) XSLT 2.0 API provides callback for suppressed (shadowed) rules

## Fixed Bugs

* (#87) XSLT 2.0 compiler stylesheet does not handle the case where the base URI of the Schematron is not available

This maintenance release of SchXslt fixes the following issue:

- #85: Compiler does not use element content of sch:let w/o @‍value attribute

I am pleased to announce the release of SchXslt 1.3, a modern XSLT-based Schematron processor.

You can download this version SchXslt from its [project page](https://github.com/schxslt/schxslt). This version of SchXslt als marks the release of [SchXslt CLI](https://github.com/schxslt/schxslt-cli), a Schematron commandline application written in Java.

Java users beware: The Java classes now live in a [separate repository](https://github.com/schxslt/schxslt-java) and as a separate Maven artifact. They follow their own versioning scheme and have a declared runtime dependency on SchXslt 1.2 or higher. The two artifacts are name.dmaus.schxslt.schxslt (the XSLT stylesheets) and name.dmaus.schxslt.java (the Java classes).

Please update your build files accordingly and sorry for the inconvenience!

## Enhancements

- (#72) Global variables are implemented as xsl:param elements whose values can be passed to the validation stylesheet.
- (#71) The SVRL reports locations of failed assertions and successful reports using [URIQualifiedNames](https://www.w3.org/TR/2017/REC-xpath-31-20170321/#doc-xpath31-URIQualifiedName).
- (#66) Inclusion of external definitions via sch:include and sch:extends is now performed recursively by the XSLT 1.0 processor as well.
- (#62) The XSLT 2.0 processor terminates with error codes.
- (#58) The XSLT 2.0 validation stylesheet reports shadowed rules in a pattern with a xsl:message and a comment in the SVRL report.

## Fixed bugs

- (#68 & #67) Fixed a bug where the XSLT 1.0 compiler entered an infinite loop when copying properties and diagnostics.
- (#70) Fixed a bug where the XSLT 1.0 compiler wrongly copied properties as diagnostic references to the SVRL.
- (#67) Fixed the implementation of the sch:name/@path attribute in the XSLT 1.0 validation stylesheet.
- (#65) Fixed a bug where the XSLT 2.0 validation stylesheet wrongly reported the URI of the schema and not the validated document in the svrl:active-pattern/@documents attribute.
- (#64) In some places the XSLT 2.0 processor did not handle the case where the base URI of a schema might is not available.
- (#63) Fixed a bug in the Java class that caused the CompilerFactory to abort if the schema contained a comment or processing instruction before the outermost element.

This maintanance release of SchXslt fixes the following bugs:

- #56 Schema title not reported in SVRL created by XSLT 1.0 validation stylesheet
- #57 Illegal shadowing of variable in XSLT 1.0 expansion step
- #60 Expansion fails if replacement contains $ character

**Heads up:** The location of the XSLT stylesheets has changed. The stylesheets for the XSLT 2.0 compiler moved from the directory src/main/resources/xslt to src/main/resources/xslt/2.0. The stylesheets of the XSLT 1.0 compiler reside in a 1.0 subdirectory accordingly. 

# Enhancements

## Support for query language XSLT 3.0

SchXslt 1.2 adds support for the not-yet-standardized query language binding for XSLT 3.0. The 2.0 compiler accepts the query language identifier token xslt3 and creates a validation stylesheet with the version attribute set to 3.0.

## Callback API

SchXslt 1.2 adds the templates schxslt-api:validation-stylesheet-body-top-hook and schxslt-api:validation-stylesheet-body-bottom-hook to the callback API. The former contributes to the top of the validation stylesheet body, the latter to the bottom. Both are called with the Schematron schema as sole argument.

## Support for query language XSLT 1.0

SchXslt 1.2 ships with an XSLT 1.0 processor that creates XSLT 1.0 validation stylesheets. Due to the limitations of this version of XSLT the XSLT 1.0 processor has the following known limitations:

- the include step is not performed recursivly; only includes from the primary schema document are replaced
- the base URI of included external definitions is not preserved
- the base URI of the primary schema document is not preserved
- the URI of the primary source document is not included in the documents attribute of the svrl:active-pattern element

## XQuery modules

SchXslt 1.2 ships with XQuery modules for BaseX and eXist. The modules are packaged as EXPath packages. Both provide the function schxslt:validate that performs Schematron validation and returns a SVRL validation report.

The packaged modules are available for download on SchXslt's page of releases.
